title: 108_hr4459
content: The Act is titled the "Llagas Reclamation Groundwater Remediation Initiative" and defines terms like groundwater remediation, local water authority, Remediation Fund, and Secretary. It establishes the California Basins Groundwater Remediation Fund. The California Basins Groundwater Remediation Fund is established within the Treasury of the United States to provide grants to local water authorities for remediation purposes. Administered by the Secretary of the Interior through the Bureau of Reclamation, it aims to reimburse the local water authority for the Federal share of remediation costs. The California Basins Groundwater Remediation Fund provides grants to local water authorities for designing and constructing groundwater remediation projects. The Secretary may not use funds until non-Federal interests contribute at least 35% of the project costs. The California Basins Groundwater Remediation Fund provides grants to local water authorities for groundwater projects. Local water authorities are responsible for the non-Federal amount required, which can be provided by the State of California, local government agencies, or private entities. The Secretary credits prior non-Federal expenditures towards the local water authority's share. The California Basins Groundwater Remediation Fund provides grants to local water authorities for groundwater projects, including expenditures by non-Federal interests for design, construction, environmental analyses, public involvement activities, and land acquisition. Federal interests acquiring lands, easements, rights-of-way, relocations, disposal areas, and water rights for groundwater remediation project. Secretary must comply with applicable laws. Activities should integrate with ongoing Federal and State projects. Authorization of $25,000,000 for the Remediation Fund, available until expended. The House of Representatives passed the bill on September 21, 2004.
